summary:
Algeria, officially the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria, is a North African country with a rich history. It has been influenced by various cultures, including the Phoenicians, Romans, and Arabs. Algeria gained independence from France in 1962 after a long war.

The country is large, covering over 2.3 million square kilometers, and has a diverse landscape, from the Sahara desert to fertile mountains. With a population of 44 million, it is mostly Arabic-speaking and follows Islam. Algeria is a regional power with significant natural resources, especially oil and gas. It plays an important role in African and global affairs.
title: Algeria
